definitions.definition: A solemn, authentic instrument in writing, by which a person declares his or her will as to disposal of his or her inheritance ( estate and effects) after his or her death, benefiting specified heir (s).

One of the two parts to the scriptures of the Christian religion : the New Testament , considered by Christians to be a continuation of the Hebrew scriptures , and the Hebrew scriptures themselves, which they refer to as the Old Testament .

examples: The ancient aqueducts are a testament to the great engineering skill of the Roman Empire.
The prime minister's speech was a glowing testament to the cabinet's undying commitment to the royal cause.

main_definition: ( law ) A solemn, authentic instrument in writing, by which a person declares his or her will as to disposal of his or her inheritance ( estate and effects) after his or her death, benefiting specified heir (s).
secondary_definitions: One of the two parts to the scriptures of the Christian religion : the New Testament , considered by Christians to be a continuation of the Hebrew scriptures , and the Hebrew scriptures themselves, which they refer to as the Old Testament .
